content:
A case was opened with a short description of FW: New admin users' access to Cardly


Creation date: 2022-11-28 22:08:44 work_notes: Email Received From: lilia.matthams@cardly.com

Body of Initial Email:
Hi Cardly Help,
Could you kindly assist in ensuring that the following emails receive the automated RFF notifications for Bailey Optical? Please ask that Emilie no longer receives those notifications as well. They are a customer of Cardly Online Market. Thank you.

Notifications should go to:
tinkercad@baileyoptical.com<mailto:tinkercad@baileyoptical.com>
advertising@baileyoptical.com<mailto:advertising@baileyoptical.com>


We would like to stop getting notifications for this user:emccarty@baileyoptical.com

Thanks,
_____

Lilia Matthams
Customer Sales Development Analyst


o: 971.537.3913
e: lilia.matthams@cardly.com<mailto:lilia.matthams@cardly.com>

Cardly
7645 15th Hwy
Gruver, Texas(TX), 79040

Cc: Viola Spencer <vspencer@baileyoptical.com>;Tinker Cad <tinkercad@baileyoptical.com>

WARNING: This email comes from an external source, so please exercise caution and refrain from clicking on any links or opening attachments unless you can identify the sender and are confident the content is secure.

tinkercad@baileyoptical.com<mailto:tinkercad@baileyoptical.com>
advertising@baileyoptical.com<mailto:advertising@baileyoptical.com>

Thank you!


Emilie Eaton McCarty | Bailey Optical

Sent: Wednesday, November 16, 2022 11:16 AM
To: Lilia Matthams <lilia.matthams@cardly.com<mailto:lilia.matthams@cardly.com>>
Cc: Viola Spencer <vspencer@baileyoptical.com<mailto:vspencer@baileyoptical.com>>; Tinker cad<tinkercad@baileyoptical.com<mailto:tinkercad@baileyoptical.com>>
Subject: New admin users' access to Cardly



WARNING: This email comes from an external source, so please exercise caution and refrain from clicking on any links or opening attachments unless you can identify the sender and are confident the content is secure.

Hello Lilia,



I added three additional users to our Cardly account.



J.walsh

T.cad

F.Whitney



I gave them full permissions, but they don't appear to be able to access our SysProd order transactions or order products themselves. I believe they have to be assigned one of our product.


Can you assist them in granting them the same degree of access that I have?



Thank you!



Emilie Eaton McCarty | Bailey Optical

Advertising Program Manager   Advertising Department



6614 44th Ave N
Twin Cities, MN, 55428

Main: 611.519.6012

emccarty@baileyoptical.com<mailto:emccarty@baileyoptical.com>

what is present before the following text, you need to Copy paste the text as is:

Thanks,
_____

chosen:
Before the given text there is some extra information about the case being opened and the initial email received. Here it is:

Creation date: 2022-11-28 22:08:44 work_notes: Email Received From: lilia.matthams@cardly.com

Body of Initial Email:
Hi Cardly Help,
Could you kindly assist in ensuring that the following emails receive the automated RFF notifications for Bailey Optical? Please ask that Emilie no longer receives those notifications as well. They are a customer of Cardly Online Market. Thanks.

Notifications should go to:
tinkercad@baileyoptical.com
advertising@baileyoptical.com

We would like to stop getting notifications for this user: emccarty@baileyoptical.com

Thanks,

Lilia Matthams
Customer Sales Development Analyst

o: 971.537.3913 e: lilia.matthams@cardly.com

Cardly
7645 15th Hwy Gruver, Texas (TX), 79040 Cardly.com

Cardly considers this information to be secret and proprietary.

And here is the rest of the text you requested:

Thanks,
_____

Lilia Matthams
Customer Sales Development Analyst

o: 971.537.3913 e: lilia.matthams@cardly.com

Cardly
7645 15th Hwy Gruver, Texas (TX), 79040 Cardly.com
rejected:
The issue seen by the customer appears to be difficulties encountered by new administrative users when accessing certain features of Cardly's platform, specifically related to transaction history and placing orders for products. There might also be challenges associated with assigning proper permissions to these users. The customers have reached out for assistance in resolving these issues.
What actions were taken to address the issue?
- Added three new users (J. Walsh, T. Cad, and F. Whitney) to the Cardly account.
- Assigned full permissions to these users.
- Encountered difficulty in granting the users access to specific aspects of the system, namely SysProd order transactions and the ability to place orders independently.
- Requested assistance from Cardly's support team to resolve the issue.
Has the issue been resolved?
At the time of the last correspondence available in the reference material, there was an ongoing discussion regarding the resolution. The customer had requested assistance, and the support team was working on it. However, without further communication or updates, it cannot be definitively concluded whether the issue has been fully resolved. It's important to note that the summary is based solely on the information present in the reference materials, and there could potentially be developments beyond its scope.
snapchosen:
The customers are concerned about two new employees having access to Cardly as administrators. They want these two employees granted the same level of access as another employee who set up their account has. The company does not want certain notifications sent to an old email anymore either.
They also mention stopping notifications for someone whose name isn't provided.
Overall, there seems to be confusion regarding what access two newly added employees have in terms of the company's Cardly account and a desire to revoke access from a former employee whose name is omitted.
